pullRequest.title: Add Page class and remove getNextPageUrl()
pullRequest.bodyText:
I carefully read the contribution guidelines and agree to them.
 I have tested the API against NewPipe.
 I agree to create a pull request for NewPipe as soon as possible to make it compatible with the changed API.

Things I'll do in this PR:

 Remove getNextPageUrl() from ListExtractor
 Make a Page class to support URL, list of IDs (instead of the current workaround for SoundCloud), and cookies (for YouTube Mix)

nodes.bodyText: This should be a Map and not HashMap, same for the contructor
I thought you are a fan of final vars :P
Why Serializable? What did I miss in the code?
As suggested in the frontend pr, a static method replacing this code would be useful
This variable could be removed alltoghether
Isn't this function a duplicate of the one in PeertubePlaylistExtractor? Shouldn't it be put in PeertubeHelper?

There are now two functions that supposedly do the same thing: getInitialPage and onFetchPage. The first one comes from ListExtractor, the other from Extractor. Since either one or the other should remain empty, I'd suggest overriding with final the onFetchPage function in ListExtractor, to make it clear that getInitialPage should be used instead
(also for other occourences)
final ;-)
Maybe it could also be a good idea to create static functions in the Page class for these kinds of common checks?

Maybe we should replace the duplicate method in the frontend with a call to this one (not in this pr though, I think)
Another note for the future: we should add tests for these utility functions, I think
Shouln't this be an empty List?

No need to check for null here, it is not possible for JsonParser.object().from() to return null: it either throws an exception or returns a valid value. So change JsonObject json = null; into JsonObject json; and add an else after the previeous if throwing the below exception
https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/nanojson/blob/master/src/main/java/com/grack/nanojson/JsonParser.java#L76.
Edit: just realised this is done everywhere else, so skip this comment ;-)
I see this is used in many places; what about adding an overload to Utils.isNullOrEmpty() taking a Response? For another PR though
final
final
final
final
final (while you are at it ;-) )
